title: Exhibition Opening: Judy Ledgerwood—Chromatic Patterns for the Art Institute of Chicago
hero_caption: Judy Ledgerwood. Chromatic Patterns for Chicago, 2011. Courtesy of the artist and Rhona Hoffman Gallery.
description:
Celebrate the opening of Chromatic Patterns for the Art Institute of Chicago, Judy Ledgerwood’s new site-specific installation for the museum’s Bluhm Family Terrace.

Covering the vertical surfaces in a pink vinyl painted with her characteristic quatrefoil pattern in gold enamel, Ledgerwood’s installation for the museum’s terrace activates the otherwise neutral modernist space. A selection of Ledgerwood’s ceramics will also be on view in the museum’s restaurant, Terzo Piano.

*Access to the Bluhm Family Terrace is always free and open to the public.
